Description: Egyptian mould-made terracotta figure. White coating and pink paint preserved on some areas. Fine red-brown silt fabric with abundant fine gold mica, quartz, and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably a relief plaque of early Hellenistic orPtolemaic (?) date.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.597) (Phase 1)
